content.description: This problem climbs the upper rail on the shield face.  Start on a large flat hold and move straight up to a great RH pinch. COntinue u and left on the rail to join the top out of the shield.
content.location: The right side of the Shield face.

content.description:
Awesome problem. Cool holds, great flow, and a scary mantle to finish it off.

Sit start on a cool blocky hold. Work through some crimps to the obvious slanted rail. Match, then fire to the lip and bust out the committing mantle.

If anyone knows what this is, let me know and I will update the page.
content.location: In the cluster of boulders with Last First Crack. Off to the left before the trail starts switchbacking up to Green A.

content.description: Fun slab problem adjacent to the Shield. Start with hands around head high. Pull-on and journey to the top.
content.location: A boulder just right of the shield face.

climbs.name: Scared to Come Out of the Closet

content.description:
A sweet crimp line only marred by the awkward position it's in.

Start low on the obvious crimp rail. Move through the series of cool edges to a jug over left, and a couple of committing moves to finish. Watch for grain on the topout.

A slightly harder variation goes right from the start to a low sidepull, then traverses back left to the same finish.
content.location: In a tight corridor above Last First Crack.

content.description: Climb the right side of the sweeping overhang.  Start standing at an obvious edge.  Climb past a good right hand sidepull. The crux is getting to and establishing on the lip at about 20 feet.  To my knowledge, this climb has only been toproped and is a prime candidate for a bouldering ascent.  There is a nice spotter's perch on the slab at your back, but an awkward fall could be bad--be careful!
content.protection: No anchors at top--plenty of options for setting up an anchor using natural protection. Bouldering the climb with a reasonable (?) degree of safety would require a fair number of crash pads and even then, it would be exciting!
content.location:
Walk to the top of

Last First Crack

.

From there, head up the climber's trail to the far western part of the Green A Gully.  You will encounter an initial zone of boulders with a beautiful north-facing problem I have heard referred to as

The Shield

(V4ish), which climbs above a pit landing.  From

The Shield

, head south down a little mini-gully through a maze of boulders.

The Red C

is nestled in a corridor that should emerge to climber's left.

content.description:
V4 version starts with a left hand on the juggy right facing side edge about 6ft up, and right hand on the rail to the right.

figure out how to reach the gritty shelf, then move left around the lip to top out. The top lip directly above the start seems thin enough to be a little sketchy to pull hard on, just top out to the left.

Extra star for the setting!

(V6 starts on the right of the rail, maybe ~V7/8 on a crimpy edge even further over)
content.location: On the N side of the West Face of one of the first boulders you come to as you enter the Green A Gully area.

content.description: Start left hand on low left edge and right in the undercling. Pull-on and move right to join the shield. Adds powerful moves into the shield.
content.protection: multiple pads. 2 or 3 big ones felt safe.

content.description: Start in the undercling and move up and slighly left to the good edge. from here delicate moves lead straight up the wall. Great fun.
content.protection: 2 big pads and a blubber. More could be better

content.description: Start on the undercling slightly right of the left arete.  Pull-on and move up and left to mantle slightly around the corner. Great fun, but the top is a bit chossy.
content.location: On the left face of the Shield boulder

content.description:
Start on good side rail, make some tricky moves up through slopers, then head left on good holds to the lip.

Top is easy, but still a little chossy. 4-5 pads and a spotter or two would be good.

extra star for novelty and the view.
content.location: NE face on a tall pointed boulder in the middle of the talus, about 100 yards uphill and east of The Shield.

content.description:
THE GOOD STUFF!

Sit start on a boulder and traverse jug underclings for a few moves, then exit through the tight squeeze formed by 3 boulders. There is a very cool sequence to navigate this thing..pretty unique.
content.location: Hmmm... it's in the first big cluster of boulders off to your left as you hike up to Green A, about 5-8 minutes from the parking. You'll see a very highball arete that hasn't been done, this problem is on the backside (west). Scramble down a short hill and it'll be hiding in a nice cave.
